column1: Art Institute of Chicago////The rest of the collection is very good as well
column2: although the museum has some very obvious weaknesses; it's really not encyclopedic the way the Met is
column4: few museums are. But fiddle-faddle. This place is full of iconic works. The huge El Grecos are probably the high point of the old master collection; some of the American paintings here are among the most famous ever painted. And
column5: although the collections of ancient art are small
column6: the objects in those collections are of high quality (and
column7: when you consider that the Oriental Institute is just a short drive away
column8: you really can't fault the museum for focusing its efforts elswhere). But the impressionists and post-impressionists really steal the show.
